docs.lead_paragraph: This year, a Seattle nurse named Kim Hiatt committed suicide. Ms. Hiatt’s death came nearly seven months after she had given an unintended overdose to an infant heart patient, a medical error that was said to have contributed to the child’s death days later.
docs.abstract: Even when a medical mistake is caught and a potential crisis averted, the health care worker who made the error is left with the knowledge of almost harming a patient he or she was trying to protect, writes nurse Theresa Brown.
docs.snippet: Even when a medical mistake is caught and a potential crisis averted, the health care worker who made the error is left with the knowledge of almost harming a patient he or she was trying to protect, writes nurse Theresa Brown.
